verses.verse: And the LORD <S%H3068><s%> said <S%H559><s%> unto Moses <S%H4872><s%>, Go <S%H935><s%> in unto Pharaoh <S%H6547><s%>: for I have hardened <S%H3513><s%> his heart <S%H3820><s%>, and the heart <S%H3820><s%> of his servants <S%H5650><s%>, that I might shew <S%H7896><s%> these my signs <S%H226><s%> before <S%H7130><s%> him:

And that thou mayest tell <S%H5608><s%> in the ears <S%H241><s%> of thy son <S%H1121><s%>, and of thy son's <S%H1121><s%> son <S%H1121><s%>, what things I have wrought <S%H5953><s%> in Egypt <S%H4714><s%>, and my signs <S%H226><s%> which I have done <S%H7760><s%> among them; that ye may know <S%H3045><s%> how that I am the LORD <S%H3068><s%>.

And Moses <S%H4872><s%> and Aaron <S%H175><s%> came in <S%H935><s%> unto Pharaoh <S%H6547><s%>, and said <S%H559><s%> unto him, Thus saith <S%H559><s%> the LORD <S%H3068><s%> God <S%H430><s%> of the Hebrews <S%H5680><s%>, How long <S%H4970><s%> wilt thou refuse <S%H3985><s%> to humble <S%H6031><s%> thyself before <S%H6440><s%> me? let my people <S%H5971><s%> go <S%H7971><s%>, that they may serve <S%H5647><s%> me.

Else <S%H3588><s%>, if thou refuse <S%H3986><s%> to let my people <S%H5971><s%> go <S%H7971><s%>, behold, to morrow <S%H4279><s%> will I bring <S%H935><s%> the locusts <S%H697><s%> into thy coast <S%H1366><s%>:

And they shall cover <S%H3680><s%> the face <S%H5869><s%> of the earth <S%H776><s%>, that one cannot be able <S%H3201><s%> to see <S%H7200><s%> the earth <S%H776><s%>: and they shall eat <S%H398><s%> the residue <S%H3499><s%> of that which is escaped <S%H6413><s%>, which remaineth <S%H7604><s%> unto you from the hail <S%H1259><s%>, and shall eat <S%H398><s%> every tree <S%H6086><s%> which groweth <S%H6779><s%> for you out of the field <S%H7704><s%>:

And they shall fill <S%H4390><s%> thy houses <S%H1004><s%>, and the houses <S%H1004><s%> of all thy servants <S%H5650><s%>, and the houses <S%H1004><s%> of all the Egyptians <S%H4714><s%>; which neither thy fathers <S%H1><s%>, nor thy fathers' <S%H1><s%> fathers <S%H1><s%> have seen <S%H7200><s%>, since the day <S%H3117><s%> that they were upon the earth <S%H127><s%> unto this day <S%H3117><s%>. And he turned <S%H6437><s%> himself, and went out <S%H3318><s%> from Pharaoh <S%H6547><s%>.

And Pharaoh's <S%H6547><s%> servants <S%H5650><s%> said <S%H559><s%> unto him, How long shall this man be a snare <S%H4170><s%> unto us? let the men <S%H582><s%> go <S%H7971><s%>, that they may serve <S%H5647><s%> the LORD <S%H3068><s%> their God <S%H430><s%>: knowest <S%H3045><s%> thou not yet <S%H2962><s%> that Egypt <S%H4714><s%> is destroyed <S%H6><s%>?

And Moses <S%H4872><s%> and Aaron <S%H175><s%> were brought again <S%H7725><s%> unto Pharaoh <S%H6547><s%>: and he said <S%H559><s%> unto them, Go <S%H3212><s%>, serve <S%H5647><s%> the LORD <S%H3068><s%> your God <S%H430><s%>: but who are they that shall go <S%H1980><s%>?

And Moses <S%H4872><s%> said <S%H559><s%>, We will go <S%H3212><s%> with our young <S%H5288><s%> and with our old <S%H2205><s%>, with our sons <S%H1121><s%> and with our daughters <S%H1323><s%>, with our flocks <S%H6629><s%> and with our herds <S%H1241><s%> will we go <S%H3212><s%>; for we must hold a feast <S%H2282><s%> unto the LORD <S%H3068><s%>.

And he said <S%H559><s%> unto them, Let the LORD <S%H3068><s%> be so with you, as I will let you go <S%H7971><s%>, and your little ones <S%H2945><s%>: look <S%H7200><s%> to it; for evil <S%H7451><s%> is before <S%H6440><s%> you.

Not so: go <S%H3212><s%> now ye that are men <S%H1397><s%>, and serve <S%H5647><s%> the LORD <S%H3068><s%>; for that ye did desire <S%H1245><s%>. And they were driven out <S%H1644><s%> from Pharaoh's <S%H6547><s%> presence <S%H6440><s%>.

¶ And the LORD <S%H3068><s%> said <S%H559><s%> unto Moses <S%H4872><s%>, Stretch out <S%H5186><s%> thine hand <S%H3027><s%> over the land <S%H776><s%> of Egypt <S%H4714><s%> for the locusts <S%H697><s%>, that they may come up <S%H5927><s%> upon the land <S%H776><s%> of Egypt <S%H4714><s%>, and eat <S%H398><s%> every herb <S%H6212><s%> of the land <S%H776><s%>, even all that the hail <S%H1259><s%> hath left <S%H7604><s%>.

And Moses <S%H4872><s%> stretched forth <S%H5186><s%> his rod <S%H4294><s%> over the land <S%H776><s%> of Egypt <S%H4714><s%>, and the LORD <S%H3068><s%> brought <S%H5090><s%> an east <S%H6921><s%> wind <S%H7307><s%> upon the land <S%H776><s%> all that day <S%H3117><s%>, and all that night <S%H3915><s%>; and when it was morning <S%H1242><s%>, the east <S%H6921><s%> wind <S%H7307><s%> brought <S%H5375><s%> the locusts <S%H697><s%>.

And the locusts <S%H697><s%> went up <S%H5927><s%> over all the land <S%H776><s%> of Egypt <S%H4714><s%>, and rested <S%H5117><s%> in all the coasts <S%H1366><s%> of Egypt <S%H4714><s%>: very <S%H3966><s%> grievous <S%H3515><s%> were they; before <S%H6440><s%> them there were no such <S%H3651><s%> locusts <S%H697><s%> as they, neither after <S%H310><s%> them shall be such.

For they covered <S%H3680><s%> the face <S%H5869><s%> of the whole earth <S%H776><s%>, so that the land <S%H776><s%> was darkened <S%H2821><s%>; and they did eat <S%H398><s%> every herb <S%H6212><s%> of the land <S%H776><s%>, and all the fruit <S%H6529><s%> of the trees <S%H6086><s%> which the hail <S%H1259><s%> had left <S%H3498><s%>: and there remained <S%H3498><s%> not any green thing <S%H3418><s%> in the trees <S%H6086><s%>, or in the herbs <S%H6212><s%> of the field <S%H7704><s%>, through all the land <S%H776><s%> of Egypt <S%H4714><s%>.

¶ Then Pharaoh <S%H6547><s%> called <S%H7121><s%> for Moses <S%H4872><s%> and Aaron <S%H175><s%> in haste <S%H4116><s%>; and he said <S%H559><s%>, I have sinned <S%H2398><s%> against the LORD <S%H3068><s%> your God <S%H430><s%>, and against you.

Now therefore forgive <S%H5375><s%>, I pray thee, my sin <S%H2403><s%> only this once <S%H6471><s%>, and intreat <S%H6279><s%> the LORD <S%H3068><s%> your God <S%H430><s%>, that he may take away <S%H5493><s%> from me this death <S%H4194><s%> only.
And he went out <S%H3318><s%> from Pharaoh <S%H6547><s%>, and intreated <S%H6279><s%> the LORD <S%H3068><s%>.

And the LORD <S%H3068><s%> turned <S%H2015><s%> a mighty <S%H3966><s%> strong <S%H2389><s%> west <S%H3220><s%> wind <S%H7307><s%>, which took away <S%H5375><s%> the locusts <S%H697><s%>, and cast <S%H8628><s%> them into the Red <S%H5488><s%> sea <S%H3220><s%>; there remained <S%H7604><s%> not one <S%H259><s%> locust <S%H697><s%> in all the coasts <S%H1366><s%> of Egypt <S%H4714><s%>.
But the LORD <S%H3068><s%> hardened <S%H2388><s%> Pharaoh's <S%H6547><s%> heart <S%H3820><s%>, so that he would not let the children <S%H1121><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%> go <S%H7971><s%>.

¶ And the LORD <S%H3068><s%> said <S%H559><s%> unto Moses <S%H4872><s%>, Stretch out <S%H5186><s%> thine hand <S%H3027><s%> toward heaven <S%H8064><s%>, that there may be darkness <S%H2822><s%> over the land <S%H776><s%> of Egypt <S%H4714><s%>, even darkness <S%H2822><s%> which may be felt <S%H4959><s%>.

And Moses <S%H4872><s%> stretched forth <S%H5186><s%> his hand <S%H3027><s%> toward heaven <S%H8064><s%>; and there was a thick <S%H653><s%> darkness <S%H2822><s%> in all the land <S%H776><s%> of Egypt <S%H4714><s%> three <S%H7969><s%> days <S%H3117><s%>:

They saw <S%H7200><s%> not one <S%H376><s%> another <S%H251><s%>, neither rose <S%H6965><s%> any <S%H376><s%> from his place for three <S%H7969><s%> days <S%H3117><s%>: but all the children <S%H1121><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%> had light <S%H216><s%> in their dwellings <S%H4186><s%>.

¶ And Pharaoh <S%H6547><s%> called <S%H7121><s%> unto Moses <S%H4872><s%>, and said <S%H559><s%>, Go <S%H3212><s%> ye, serve <S%H5647><s%> the LORD <S%H3068><s%>; only let your flocks <S%H6629><s%> and your herds <S%H1241><s%> be stayed <S%H3322><s%>: let your little ones <S%H2945><s%> also go <S%H3212><s%> with you.

And Moses <S%H4872><s%> said <S%H559><s%>, Thou must give <S%H5414><s%> us <S%H3027><s%> also sacrifices <S%H2077><s%> and burnt offerings <S%H5930><s%>, that we may sacrifice <S%H6213><s%> unto the LORD <S%H3068><s%> our God <S%H430><s%>.

Our cattle <S%H4735><s%> also shall go <S%H3212><s%> with us; there shall not an hoof <S%H6541><s%> be left behind <S%H7604><s%>; for thereof must we take <S%H3947><s%> to serve <S%H5647><s%> the LORD <S%H3068><s%> our God <S%H430><s%>; and we know <S%H3045><s%> not with what we must serve <S%H5647><s%> the LORD <S%H3068><s%>, until we come <S%H935><s%> thither.
¶ But the LORD <S%H3068><s%> hardened <S%H2388><s%> Pharaoh's <S%H6547><s%> heart <S%H3820><s%>, and he would <S%H14><s%> not let them go <S%H7971><s%>.

And Pharaoh <S%H6547><s%> said <S%H559><s%> unto him, Get <S%H3212><s%> thee from me, take heed <S%H8104><s%> to thyself, see <S%H7200><s%> my face <S%H6440><s%> no more <S%H3254><s%>; for in that day <S%H3117><s%> thou seest <S%H7200><s%> my face <S%H6440><s%> thou shalt die <S%H4191><s%>.
And Moses <S%H4872><s%> said <S%H559><s%>, Thou hast spoken <S%H1696><s%> well <S%H3651><s%>, I will see <S%H7200><s%> thy face <S%H6440><s%> again <S%H3254><s%> no more.
